suggested_topics: the engineering of ancient Roman aqueducts
how mycelium networks share resources underground
the economics of food trucks in major cities
the role of smell in human memory formation

formats.name: dream_fragment
formats.instruction: Describe a vivid, surreal dream memory in ONE paragraph. Focus on sensory detail and leave out explanations. Make it feel mysterious.

formats.name: mini_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare your philosophy on something (life, work, love, etc.) in a passionate statement. One paragraph, no hedging, just raw conviction.

formats.name: microfiction
formats.instruction: Write a complete fictional story in exactly THREE sentences. Make it surprising or twisty. No more, no less.

formats.name: visual_list
formats.instruction: List THREE things you noticed recently, then describe each with a single sensory image. Keep it concise but vivid.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Share something you regret or would NOT recommend people do. Frame it as 'Don't do X.' Explain why in 2-4 sentences.

formats.name: deep_dive_anatomy
formats.instruction: Dissect a complex process or phenomenon. Break it into major parts, give each a short explanation. Minimum four sections, rich detail.

formats.name: awkward_confession
formats.instruction: Admit to something awkward, unusual, or embarrassing. Briefly describe what happened and how you felt. Two paragraphs max.

formats.name: future_letter
formats.instruction: Write a letter to your future self about a current challenge or hope. Address it sincerely, include questions and advice.

formats.name: comparison_chart
formats.instruction: Compare two unusual things (objects, ideas, trends) in chart format. Use at least three categories. Provide witty or unexpected explanations.

formats.name: one_word_story
formats.instruction: Tell a story using only single-word sentences (one word per line). Minimum ten words. Let it create its own rhythm.

title_styles: Write a title that sounds like a headline from an alternate universe newspaper.
Write a mysterious title that teases a secret or discovery, but doesn’t give it away.
Write a title as a question a curious outsider would ask: 'Why does X even exist?'
Write an absurd, humorous title that exaggerates the topic wildly.
Write a poetic title inspired by a single vivid image or feeling.
structure_variants: Break your post into stanzas, as if writing a poem (even if it’s not).
Use a clock motif: frame your points as moments in a day (e.g., ‘9:00 AM: ...’).
Include instructions for the reader at the end, as if they must take action.
Begin and end your post with the same phrase for symmetry.
Frame the body as a list of ‘what if’ scenarios.
Use alternating sentences: one factual, one emotional.
topic_angles: Explore the invisible rules people follow in public spaces.
Examine odd digital trends nobody seems to notice.
Investigate the emotional impact of small, overlooked objects.
Ponder the secret lives of pets when humans are away.
Analyze how boredom enables unexpected creativity.
